se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Interface ProposalAcceptor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InfoProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HillClimbingAcceptor, MetropolisHastingsAcceptor

    public interface ProposalAcceptor
extends InfoProvider
    Interface for probabilistic techniques of determining whether a suggested parameter state change should be accepted or not. At the moment this has been written with Metropolis-Hastings-like methods in mind, so it is subject to change to become more general.

    See also MetropolisHastingsAcceptor and HillClimbingAcceptor.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean acceptProposedState(LogDouble proposedStateLikelihood, LogDouble oldStateLikelihood, java.util.List<Proposal> proposals)
      Returns true if a proposed state x' should be accepted, or false if the old state x should be retained.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.InfoProvider

        getPostInfo, getPreInfo

    • Method Detail

      • acceptProposedState

        boolean acceptProposedState(LogDouble proposedStateLikelihood,
                          LogDouble oldStateLikelihood,
                          java.util.List<Proposal> proposals)
                            throws RunAbortedException
        Returns true if a proposed state x' should be accepted, or false if the old state x should be retained.
        Parameters:
        proposedStateLikelihood - the likelihood P(x').
        oldStateLikelihood - the likelihood P(x).
        proposals - details the proposals made for going from x to x'. May be null for certain implementations (e.g. hill-climbing).
        Returns:
        true if suggested state accepted; false if rejected.
        Throws:
        RunAbortedException
